projects.title: Real Estate And Sustainable Crisis Management in Urban Environments (RESCUE) project
projects.description:
How will crises affect people's wellbeing in the built environment? We create measures that can help us design, build and occupy the built environment – whether at home or the workplace – so that it can adapt to changing circumstances. 
The study is multidisciplinary, a combination of future studies, architecture, land use and spatial planning and real estate economics.

contributors.headline: Real estate business and workplace management

projects.title: Virpa D (Virtuaalinen palveluympäristö-D) project
projects.description:
Joint project of universities and businesses aims to create world-class user experiences for business users to promote work productivity, everyday fluency and well-being.
During the Virpa D project, new user-driven services will be developed for the international market. The core of the solutions is to improve user experience. Good user experience generates added value, promotes commitment to the business and generates business benefits. The Virpa-D project is estimated to generate 740M € new turnover, 342M € new exports and 1 569 new jobs.
The project also provides research on the future needs of user services, user experience design, business models, data collection and analytics as well as the architecture of digital platforms.

contributors.headline: Real estate business and workplace management

projects.title: Tilat avoimiksi - fiksu tilaverkko (Opening up spaces - Smart network of spaces)
projects.description: In this smart space network project, the goal is to create a flexible space model and space network specifically for school network needs. Another goal is to find ways for flexible and sustainable space utilization and create a business case for the city of Helsinki and network of partners

contributors.headline: Real estate business and workplace management

projects.title: PATI - Palvelu korvaa tilan
projects.description:
Because of the current changes, the main aim of this research is to develop a service innovation that supports the multi-locational work and that would support employees to work in a smarter way. From facility management point of view the core product is not anymore the offered and maintained office space, but a smart service that would support multi-locational work.
In this research the ideas, approaches and methods of lean management are utilized in the development and operationalization of the smart service. The methods of lean management are practical methods that aim for customer value creation and waste elimination.
Workspace as a service - a silver bullet for multi-locational work?

projects.title: Aalto in Africa
projects.description: Aalto in Africa was a student-driven innovation project, taking 50 students from design, business, engineering and law, in addition to staff members from Aalto University and corporate partners first to the Zambian wilderness, through Johannesburg, all the way to Cape Town. Our goal was to learn from and co-create with local communities through workshops and longer-term projects in order to achieve a unique, multidisciplinary learning experience. This was not an aid-related project, but rather a project that will allow students to learn from the locals in Zambia and South Africa. The travelling program consisted courses, workshops for our partners, visits to local companies and organizations.

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Lecturer and Researcher

profile_positions.description: Suomi-Liettua kauppayhdistys tarjoaa yhteydenpitokanavan Suomen ja Liettuan kaupassa ja taloudellisessa yhteistyössä toimiville yrityksille ja yksilöille. Toiminnan tarkoituksena on edistää Suomen ja Liettuan välisiä taloussuhteita ja investointeja sekä edesauttaa maitten välisen taloudellisen ja oikeudellisen vuorovaikutuksen lisäämistä.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
FIFMA is a Finnish workplace management association whose goal is to develop and maintain the professional skills of its members, to develop office environment and education, and to promote domestic and international relationships within its field by providing networking opportunities and information on industry trends.

FIFMA is the Finnish Chapter of the International Facility Management Association (IFMA) and is acting as an agent for RAKLI. FIFMA organizes various events, many of them in collaboration with the RAKLI Work Environment Network. These include the Workplace Benchmark events and the Work Environment of the Year competition, which aims to raise awareness and enhance the social impact of workplace management.

Membership in the FIFMA Association is possible by applying in writing to the board of the association.
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description:
Experience in: research, project planning, stakeholder management, leadership activities. 
Skills: data analysis, organisation, problem-solving, decision-making, strategic-thinking, communication and mentoring. 

Postdoctoral research: workplace management, business models, servitization, digitalisation/Proptech in commercial real estate. 

Teaching real estate economics and facility and property management to master's students.
